intro: Psychotria granadensis, commonly known as the Granada psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are usually white or pale green with prominent red or purple calyces.
